If you're looking for something light but great with videos and basic school/gaming then this is what you want. Definitely something I'll be looking for in future laptops and computers.

Reviews.Title: Acer aspire 5733 laptopI a
Reviews.Author: Carol S. Raulston
Reviews.Content: I bought the 5733 laptop and only a few months later the password stopped working.  This means I can make no changes to my computer.  I tried accessing customer support only to discover it is NON-EXISTENT.  The only sources I could access wanted to charge $199 per year for support.  Since I am 100% sure i made no changes to the password, I am highly frustrated with Acer.  I will NEVER buy another Acer for this reason.

Reviews.Title: Had to send in for repairs
Reviews.Author: Jessica Biloxi
Reviews.Content: After less than a month of use, the touchpad went out. I had to pay to ship it to the Acer repair center. All they did was return the unit to its factory settings which somehow took several weeks. They did this even though I had already taken all the steps to resolve any software issues and explicitly told them and demonstrated that it was a hardware issue. When I got it back, it worked for about a week before, shockingly, the touchpad started having the same issues. After dealing with customer service for hours, I finally got them to agree to pay for shipping it back again. Unfortunately I am in the middle of a big project right now and can't be without a laptop again for weeks. So I am stuck using a USB mouse (which sucks because I work in my vehicle a lot; touchpad would be super useful) until I can pack it up and send it away for who knows how long. It's a good laptop otherwise, but dealing with the repair problems has taken out way too much of my time and productivity.

Reviews.Title: Disfuntional battery or charger upon arrival
Reviews.Author: cartere
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get this computer. That is until I actually got it. I opened it up, let it charge for a while then installed my preferences. However, I come to realize that either my battery is defective or they sent me a useless charger... nonetheless right now my computer is completely useless and although Acer has been helpful, it has not been an enjoyable experience. Acer support will be sending me a new charger and I will update my review if this situation is fixed. Mind you this problem was experienced on the first day that I received it. You would think they would test their product before selling it.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work!!!
Reviews.Author: Sadie Sue
Reviews.Content: Purchased this computer and, due to illness, was unable to try using it until now, 7 month later, and it doesn't work!!!  Got it to turn on, which took forever and then it would not turn back on.  We had given it a full charge before trying to use it so know it did not lack power.  The next day my husband got it to turn on and he took our McAfee and installed Norton, which I have on other 2 computers, and it worked for short time.  Today computer will not turn on and our daughter in law was over and she tried, repeatedly, to get it to work to no avail.  She told me that she had purchased the same computer and just took it back as it had same problem.  Now I am stuck with computer that doesn't work!!!!  I would suggest you look at other Brands and not buy ACER!  I originally bought this due to it still having Windows 7 and that is a system I prefer.

Reviews.Title: Bad choice on my part.....for the thousandth time!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this item used from Warehouse Deals.......huge mistake! It was locked when I got it and I was unable to log on to it. So when I finally figured out how to restore it from the start up screen, the internet would not work via wifi or cable. SMH. I was really hoping this one worked considering the deal I got on it and it has Windows 7. Some PC Manufacturers sell Windows 7 PCs, but I don't want a 15.6 in screen. Well I'll suck it up and brace myself for Windows 8. Guess I will buy a new one and hopefully it works. I do not recommend this item. On my way to the UPS dropbox.

Reviews.Title: Unimpressed
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I returned this product. I disliked the mouse touch pad, it kept resizing the screen font without intention.  The price might be right but it just seemed cheap,

Reviews.Title: Shiny New Windows 7 Gem
Reviews.Author: D. Young "Dixie Cup"
Reviews.Content: I have a full size Windows 8 laptop that will now be the back-up to this little treasure.  It does everything the big one does just as well and sometimes faster. The big plus for me is not having to put up with the very counter-intuitive Windows 8 operating system. On my sweet little Acer I can actually do simple things simply like find what I'm looking for, mass delete junk mail, copy, paste,  print, etc.  I love that little windows are not flying out from all 4 sides of the screen at me if my finger is not perfectly placed on the track pad. Welcome home, Windows 7- I missed you.I watch a lot of videos on Swagbucks.com and they play seamlessly with no crashing. The McAfee free trial it came with is doing a great job filtering potentially harmful content from said videos keeping my Acer safe while I rack up Amazon gift cards!There are 4 small things I am less than thrilled with. There is no light on the keyboard to signal the caps lock is on but an Icon will pop up on screen to let you know which takes some getting used to. A tap on the track pad does not always work- just move your finger slightly and try again. There is no optical drive which would make backing up easier but that's all I would use it for anyway. The battery is good but not as good as the specs indicate which is probably typical. No worries, I will pick up a spare with one of my gift cards. I'm also snagging on of those cool aqua blue snap on covers I spotted today. Love me some Amazon, Swagbucks, and this little Acer!

Reviews.Title: Compact and responsive
Reviews.Author: Brent B.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a lightweight computer with a full key board to use for  global travel.  During my first work assignment overseas the Aspire has proven to be just what I need.  I primarily need it for word processing and checking the internet but really appreciate the dependable Windows7 system.

Reviews.Title: Good enough
Reviews.Author: SpacemanEd
Reviews.Content: Likes:  Bang for the buck.  Windows 7 64-bit.  Chiclet keyboard; good key size.  Plenty fast enough. Light.  Clear, crisp monitor.  Can take it and use it anywhere.  Set-up is easy. Very good, if not outstanding, battery life.Dislikes:  Glossy case shows fingerprints; a cleaning cloth is included, though.  Sound is tinny - RealTek audio is included, but you'll need to play with the audio controls to make the sound tolerable on some websites.I've seen some reviews of folks unhappy that it doesn't lay flat.  That's due to the oversized extra-life battery.  The slight tilt is better ergonomically anyway.Background:  This is my 2nd one of these.  First was for my wife, to replace her full-size XP laptop.  She works from home and our small business office and when traveling.  Comfort and portability are key to her.  It's common for her to have Word, Excel, an Access database, Outlook, and our proprietary cloud employee management system open at the same time.  This laptop handles it, and my wife has become quite the Windows 7 Toggle Queen.  Rarely uses the office desktop anymore.Once my 80-year-old mother saw and played a bit with my wife's new computer, she wanted one for herself to replace her obsolete XP desktop.  Windows 8 on a full-size laptop for Mom was an absolute non-starter.  Mom uses it for her e-mail, browsing, Quicken and that's about it.  Took it with her on a cross-country trip.  Her biggest pleasure (actually, maybe mine) is instead of having to browse at a desk in a spare bedroom, she now reads her morning news and e-mails at the kitchen table or on the patio, with a cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: Very functional machine with a decent sized screen
Reviews.Author: cancer
Reviews.Content: Formerly I was using a Toshiba (solid and reliable for 5 years), but this is a better machine than the comparable Toshiba one. I love the larger screen size and the slightly angled display thanks to feet under the keyboard. The single mouse is actually easy to use and has the added advantage of being able to minimize or magnify also. The only negative about it is the speakers are stupidly placed underneath the keyboard, so if you are watching a program, you will probably want to use headphones. Fortunately this is readily remedied. I use this computer for writing, some EXCEL work, and for research, as well as for entertainment. It is not my only laptop, merely my newest.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: It was slow and froze on me after initial set up. Sent it back for refund. Don't recommend this item

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: dram
Reviews.Content: I have only owned this for about a month so I can't really comment on this laptop's longevity.I needed a thin, lightweight laptop that I could carry to night classes. I am studying computer science, so this is a perfect machine for tooling around with programming, virtual machines, etc. I didn't need to spend gobs of money on a MacBook, I wouldn't use most of the bells and whistles anyway. This laptop is well made and it actually packs a lot of features for the money. It has Bluetooth, HDMI, large storage, 4GB memory! The only noticeable thing that is lacking is the graphics display. The screen is a little bit pixelated. So it's not a good choice if you will be watching a lot of high res movies or games. Otherwise great little machine. I hope it lasts!

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire V5-131-2629 11.6" Laptop expectations
Reviews.Author: Lester R. Burroughs
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop for a friend whose original laptop had insufficient processor speed and RAM to download anything but short e-mails. My friend loves the new laptop. She is now able to do research on any topic sh choses and to download pictures and large text articles. This little laptop is a winner!

Reviews.Title: Great PC
Reviews.Author: Lorena Sikorski
Reviews.Content: This little PC is fast and a great buy.  I didn't realize that it didn't have aCD drive, but I can live without one.  It's lightweight,  speedy and easy to use.A great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great product from Acer
Reviews.Author: Dean C. Dickinson
Reviews.Content: Just right to keep up with news and emails while we are traveling across the country. It has the Windows 7 operating system and I bought MS office home and student so I can access my Word and Excel files while on the road. I also equipped it with a wireless mouse to use in lieu of the touchpad (which can be toggled on and off by pressing the Fn and F7 keys). LOVE the large keyboard. A great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great for Travel
Reviews.Author: Kenneth R. Velten "California Ken"
Reviews.Content: We use this computer when we travel.  It is lightweight and easily fits in a carry on bag.  Has all the features of a desk top.  The screen is big enough for most applications.  I use an external disc drive to load from discs.  Keyboard is good and the display is good.  We are satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great bargain..
Reviews.Author: Mary M Koss "mcdak"
Reviews.Content: I could do without all the extra adware stuff on it though.  I didn't recognize a lot of it and was afraid to delete things I don't recognize. It works a lot faster now that  my son has deleted the extras.

Reviews.Title: Its fine for what I use it for
Reviews.Author: Neill Hamilton
Reviews.Content: The keyboard is adequate, the battery lasts about 5 hours.  The software loaded on the computer by Acer is not too annoying, and Word Starter is fine for my purposes.  It accepts the data card from my camera. If you load Google Chrome it surfs the net just fine.The only drawbacks were that the Norton Anti-virus software didn't work, and the keypad is very sensitive.  I loaded Microsoft Security Essentials for the anti-virus, and have learned to live with the sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: an excellant choice
Reviews.Author: barbkubera
Reviews.Content: excellant choice- compact, full keyboard which is very easy to use, not tiny keys-fast and just what I had wanted.highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Was Perfect For Me
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Marshall "Chris"
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect, light weight, small footprint, long battery life (4+ hours) notebook for me. It's surprisingly fast for its size. I use it for watching video and surfing the web. I bought a Windows 8 notebook and hated the interface plus it seemed slow. I didn't want to ascend a steep learning curve just to watch a video or figure out how to shut down, so I returned it and was so happy to find this little gem still available with Windows 7. I haven't experienced any keyboard or touchpad issues. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: great  compact computer
Reviews.Author: james thompson
Reviews.Content: Grate small laptop perfect for travel. mouse pad is a littel different but is easy to adapt to but meets all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great Performance!
Reviews.Author: nilesfrancis
Reviews.Content: I'm an Apple user, but needed a PC for a specific and dedicated purpose.  This notebook was recommend to me and the reviews were favorable.  It is good value for the money.  Get a small mouse to navigate as track pad is not particularly responsive.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: For a PC and the price this was a good computer. It is small and light. The battery is also 'legs' for the computer which is neat. It already has shortcuts on the desktop for things such as Netflix, and the Nook reader, which saved some time. Sometime it runs slow but we will see how long it lasts?

Reviews.Title: Happy  with computer
Reviews.Author: Betsey
Reviews.Content: I find it easy to read---quick to respond--nice size----this computer is a big improvement over my smaller Dell notebook--would recommend it

Reviews.Title: First PC purchased that the purformace was priced cheap!!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard A Byrum
Reviews.Content: It  has great screen and sound, Be sure to update video drivers, they will b @ Intel. Battery life is great, I charge it two days.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire V5-131-2629 11.6" Laptop (Black)
Reviews.Author: Sharon D. Large
Reviews.Content: My son and husband love this laptop and use it frequently. I have a larger and older Aspire laptop that I use all the time. I recommend this brand to everyone because I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great small laptop
Reviews.Author: avid mystery reader
Reviews.Content: We wanted a smaller laptop to take with us when we go on short trips and vacation so we can keep up with the news, etc.  I was surprised how fast this laptop is, it is quicker than my larger one.  The price was also great.

Reviews.Title: Big Help
Reviews.Author: JAIME MUNGUIA
Reviews.Content: It's now 6 years old, still works fine. I started my online freelance carrier using it .. maid my first buck and 12x netbook price using it! I gave it to my father and bought High configuration desktop for me. ..

Reviews.Title: Parents love it!
Reviews.Author: flyingmonkie
Reviews.Content: Got this for my parents about 6 months ago and they absolutely love it!  Does everything they need.  Was afraid it would be too small for them, but they always comment on how perfect the size is.

Reviews.Title: Just right
Reviews.Author: Erdsters
Reviews.Content: Everything as expected, great little laptop. excellent service. Easy start up.great battery life, bluetooth works perfect. built in kickstand is nice

Reviews.Title: Acer was listed as one of the top computers for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Loraine D.Anspach
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my granddaughter.  She loves it.  I checked on the internet for a computer for her and this seemed to be a very good one for her needs when she starts college.  It had good reports on it and I also had an Acer for my first computer, which was given to me. I would recommend this computer to others.  Reasonable in price and is just the best for her.

Reviews.Title: COMPUTER SUMMARY
Reviews.Author: KEVIN KULL
Reviews.Content: I DID SOME RESEARCH AND GOT WHAT I ORDERED, THAT'S  WHAT I WANTED SO I AM HAPPY WITH IT! HOPEFULLY IT WILL ALWAYS WORK OUT THIS WELL!

Reviews.Title: A Real Performer
Reviews.Author: Stanley O. Epstein
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very reasonably priced and does everything that I needed it for, and then some.  My primary purpose was to connect it up so that i could do the procedures while lying down and viewing everything on my TV screen.  Stan Epstein

Reviews.Title: The only Windows 7 computer that I could find
Reviews.Author: mazie
Reviews.Content: I love it.  I was afraid the keyboard would be too small and hard to use, but no problems at all.  I hated Windows 8 and this was recommended by a friend who has one and loves it too.  I have no complaints and highly recommend it.  All of the keys are perfectly tight/loose, however you want to put it.  Not too sticky, not too loose that you accidentally hit the wrong one.

Reviews.Title: Very Decent for Price
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my job search and it has served that purpose well. The wireless internet card has not had any issues, and I am able to have multiple Modzilla tabs open at once without any problems (I also have multiple word documents open at the same time-- this has not caused any issues). Occasionally I watch short (10 min) Youtube videos, which seem to run fine.The battery usually lasts 6-7 hours between charges. I like how this computer is light and very easy to carry around-- it is similar to the size of a book!The only problem I run into is that my Solitaire games sometimes stall out,  which is remedied when I minimize and re-open the window (weird!). This machine probably wouldn't work for on-line gaming or more demanding applications, but it works for my purposes. Overall, I am happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: good netbook but
Reviews.Author: Jazzygirl719
Reviews.Content: This netbook was a gift for my ex so I decided to keep it instad of returning it after having it engraved.it is a functional PC however the processor has some lag

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Daren Arellano
Reviews.Content: This computer is a good alternative if you want to work for essential stuffs. I really like it a lot

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire
Reviews.Author: Peg Dienhart
Reviews.Content: More of a notebook than a laptop...quite small/compact.  Works great - but find the mouse is extremely sensitive.  Also need to determine how to quite getting all the dang pop-ups that seem to have come with it.  A little smaller than I wanted, but it's functional.

Reviews.Title: Nice computer for price
Reviews.Author: Andrew F.
Reviews.Content: I think it is a great computer. I've had it for about a month. I have had no issues with it. It is a compact size. I was expecting it to have the DVD Drive in it. I just didn't read the Specs on it close enough before I bought it. I don't watch a lot of DVDs anyway. I just use a portable DVD player to download info. Good deal on it Though.

Reviews.Title: JUST WHAT I NEEDED
Reviews.Author: J. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Small, light weight. Still could get Win7. Ideal if you do a lot of traveling. Does not have to have battery installed if plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Seems to work ok - reserving right to comment again later on down the road if it fails to live up to its advertisement ratings.
Reviews.Author: M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Arrived via UPS packed fairly decently but I would have liked to have seen more padding around it in a larger box from Amazon as it was too tight in its box from the manufacturer and the way the delivery company handled it (carrying it with one hand) didn't seem so safe for a $350 price.  --Aside from that, it seems to work ok, the only minor problem was that when I uninstalled MacAfee's Anti-Virus big whopping generous 1 month trial (can they spare it?sheesh!) and after thoroughly cleaning it off my machine and then trying to load one of the much better freeware anti-virus programs I know works much much better (and costs nothing) - the program wouldn't install until I manually chose a specific folder (of 5 choices) for where the usually automatic "download manager" to download the program to. A quick attempt to reach Acer techs to ask met with a very convoluted system designed to prevent you from calling them, and or chatting with them either-- so I called a friendly tech I know at ANOTHER  company - and he answered my question for free.  I would have bought his company's computer but it was out of my price range. I'll give this Acer a try however, and if after a year it;ls still working ok (or before that if it doesn't), I'll update this review.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this laptop
Reviews.Author: Sojourner Truth "Sojourner Truth"
Reviews.Content: I have two older Acer Aspire netbooks, the older, smaller versions of this one.  I use one to run my amateur radio station and the second to run my weather station.I use this one for my volunteer work . . . haul it around from rescue squad to museum to free clinic.I'm somewhat puzzled at other commenters who say the keyboard doesn't respond and the mousepad is not sensitive.  I find exactly the opposite . . . I've had no problems with the keyboard and I find the mousepad to be a bit too sensitive.Battery life is great; I'm getting 5 - 6 hours from a charge.  The battery tilts the laptop slightly forward and I find that quite convenient.No DVD player, but, I have an external HP DVD drive that plugs into the USB port and works fine.

Reviews.Title: Acer
Reviews.Author: pat d.
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great,and I really like it. Would recommend to family and friends. My nephew has already bought one.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Ramblin Gamber
Reviews.Content: Got it as a gift for my wife, she loves it.  I liked that it was still available in windows 7, I was afraid I was going to have to use windows 8 (I plan to skip that OS altogether).  I wish it had a touch screen, but it looks like only the windows 8 laptops had touch screens.

Reviews.Title: a lot of bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Glenn Harvey
Reviews.Content: unit booted up at once and has preformed to all expectations and beyound, I would gladly do it again thank you

Reviews.Title: 5 star good laptop, great prize
Reviews.Author: Stretch
Reviews.Content: The laptop is light, easy for travelOthers laptop I have are heavier, harder for travelGood prize, not to worry too much, when travel with

Reviews.Title: MUCH BETTER KEYBOARD THAN EARLIER MODELS
Reviews.Author: Shopperdeluxe
Reviews.Content: I had a smaller early version that I carried around forever because a netbook is so convenient.  This one is a little larger but I can actually type on this keyboard instead of having to resort to using two fingers because the keyboard was so small and awkward.  I have been confined to bed with a broken foot, and this allowed me to keep up with the world and my work.  The netbook is also much faster than my desktop.

Reviews.Title: Overall good computer
Reviews.Author: Cbutzkazoo
Reviews.Content: I got this as a replacement to my Acer Apire One...which I loved, but it was 5 years old and needed to be replaced. I like the bigger screen and Windows 7. I don't like the keyboard as much as the old one due to the fact that the keys are spread out instead of touching each other. I can't type as fast, maybe as I get used to it I'll like it better. I don't like that it's heavier than my old one, but not too big of a deal. At first I had trouble staying connected to the internet with the new one, while all my other devices had no problems, but after resetting my modem and router it seems to be doing better at keeping the connection. Overall this is a good computer.

Reviews.Title: Daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: CrazyCatLady
Reviews.Content: My daughter needed to replace her old laptop and wanted something smaller. This is definitely smaller! We looked at different brands and read reviews before deciding on this as being the best value for her money. I don't like that it doesn't have a separate number keypad, but she doesn't mind. Haven't heard any complaints out of her yet about it and she downloads and/or watches lots of shows and uses it for her college classes.

Reviews.Title: Aser Aspire
Reviews.Author: Patrick Irelan
Reviews.Content: Very reliable laptop. It's light and easy to transport. I take it with me everywhere I go. It was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great lil laptop
Reviews.Author: Lisa Taylor
Reviews.Content: This laptop was easy and simple to set up and get started.. perfect for my home and easy for my kids to use.  The speakers could have been better but it wasn't a deal breaker... this is a great little laptop... love it!

Reviews.Title: Bought for work
Reviews.Author: AZ Frequent Flyer
Reviews.Content: My work requires me to do a lot of work in the field, so instead of writing it all out and then coming back to the office, I could use this in the field and then copy/paste to an email and send it to work, and then copy/paste from there, no sense doing work twice.  I had to buy a wireless mouse to go with it, as I am old school and hate the pad, but knew that before I bought it, now it works great, need to get adjusted to the key board, as I am used to a bigger one and pounding.  Too bad my company does not provide us with these, or reinburse, but almost everyone goes and buys there own, so why bother, hope it can come off my taxes, as otherwise I had no reason to buy it.  It  works just fine, and I ordered it because it had Windows 7 on it, I didn't want the hassle of Windows 8, I wanted to be ready to go..

Reviews.Title: Great size!
Reviews.Author: minnie
Reviews.Content: This is a great size for my needs. But......it will not send letters and freezes up frequently. I always have to restart it. Slow but fine for my kitchen use.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Kristopher Garity
Reviews.Content: This laptop is a great buy. I would recommend this to any of my friends or family. I love it.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Cameron Klein
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop for my Christmas present and so far I have had no problems with it and it is a great laptop for the price

Reviews.Title: Its very good for its price.
Reviews.Author: Ortodontic
Reviews.Content: I had to replace my old netbook, I found this pretty netbook for 299 dollars, what a good de al I did. After a week of use, I think it is better than I spected. My lema in laptops is: buy the cheapest you find, they dont support moré than 3 years.

Reviews.Title: Nice little travel laptop
Reviews.Author: R. Carlson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little laptop for travel, with much of the power of a full-size laptop.  Keyboard is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire V5-131-2629 11.6" Laptop
Reviews.Author: Katharine A. Espinoza
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer for my future travels.  I recently travelled to Europe, and took my 17" laptop, as well as cameras, etc. and decided then that I would look for a smaller computer, and this one is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Maria Sandoval
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Comes as is as pictured, well packed. Thanks for the Sale and Happy Holidays. Very good. very nice

Reviews.Title: Works great for me.
Reviews.Author: T. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I really like the size of this laptop. Very portable. Also, I was ready to go back to Windows 7. I don't hate Windows 8 but I really prefer 7. No internal CD/DVD drive but given how rarely I use them, no big deal. Would recommend this computer.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Joey Cook
Reviews.Content: loves this computer I needed a step up from my windows vista desk top. I use it for my photography bussiness and internet and it downloads all my photos perfectly. Of course I keep my photos in another place so I didnt need alot of storage space.

Reviews.Title: Acer laptop
Reviews.Author: yokosen
Reviews.Content: It's in perfect condition, and works very well. I'm so glad I purchased this item, as a gift for someone.

Reviews.Title: Simple and well designed
Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: great buy--simple and efficient. I replaced an aging Toshiba for use as a quick internet source on the kitchen counter.

Reviews.Title: My new computer
Reviews.Author: Fred Yule
Reviews.Content: Great product. I had a little problem adjusting to the small screen but works fine as long as I remember to carry my glasses. I do a lot of traveling so the small size is perfect. Fred Yule

Reviews.Title: Nice small laptop
Reviews.Author: MT G'ma
Reviews.Content: This one fits in my oversized bag -- no need for a big briefcase. I really like the size and I'm a fan of the ACERS.

Reviews.Title: All I hoped for
Reviews.Author: Gary Smith
Reviews.Content: This computer is a perfect traveler with a long battery life and it is FAST! I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: KEYBOARD SUCKS!!!!
Reviews.Author: Shuga
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer two years ago and within a year the "T" button on the keyboard went bad. I had no way of replacing it so I had to buy a whole new key kit to replace the one button. Within six months of replacement, three other keys had the same problem---including the first key that had the issue!!! It is so annoying trying to type with it. Now I have to attach a wireless keyboard in order to make it functional! What a waste

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire not fully what I expected
Reviews.Author: Susan C. Thomson
Reviews.Content: The Acer Aspire arrived on time and the setup was easy. I bought it to be able to dedicate a small, portable laptop to my writing and was surprised to learn that I needed to buy a word processing program to do so. The "Starter" MS Office (Word) did not function like I expected it to. So now, after spending a substantial amount of money, I can actually do what the purpose of my purchase was.The other issue is that the touch pad is not very sensitive and the space bar, when typed, only makes a space about 50% of the time.

Reviews.Title: several keys on the keyboard don't work
Reviews.Author: JES
Reviews.Content: I just received this today, and everything seemed great -- but I soon discovered that three of the keys just don't work ( the 5, 7, and 9).  I'm obviously going to have to return it, which is a major pain. I guess I'll ask for a replacement; I hope that happens quickly, since I really need a laptop within the next two weeks. I'll update this review with the outcome of the return.

Reviews.Title: Defective product
Reviews.Author: Palma You
Reviews.Content: The Acer service center told me someone called about this particular laptop in March 2014 and it didn't work then. Amazon sent it out to me in May 2014. Lucky me, it still has the same problem, the screen is defected.

Reviews.Title: Let down by the keyboard and touchpad
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: This is a decent mini laptop (I won't call this "ultrabook" because it is obviously built for the bodget-minded). Nice solid construction. Decent screen. The Celeron is adequate for general internet browsing, social networking, Skype and simple Office work. The battery life is decent for its weight and size.My biggest pet peeve is the KEYBOARD - keystrokes are shallow and sometime inaccurate, plus, some keys such as the "O" and "Z" are faulty - this should never happen in a brand-new laptop. Bad keyboard is obviously a cost-cutting measure, but keyboard is so important on a laptop computer!! The touchpad performance is also sub-par - navigating the pointer and double-tapping are not very sensitive.I was so mad about the bad keys I actually bought an OEM replacement keyboard. It just arrived today and I spent two hours replacing it (quite a chore!), and then to find out that the <arrow down> key is faulty!!! At least all the letter and number keys work alright, and I can get by using the mouse. This just shows that Acer uses low quality keyboards.

Reviews.Title: second time around is better than the first time!
Reviews.Author: C. Van Blake
Reviews.Content: This is my second Acer Aspire notebook and I swear by them.  They are sturdy, fast, light weight and have all the computing power of a much larger machine in a smaller, more convenient package.  I love them!  For serious computing power on the go this is the machine. Invest in a good carrying case that protects it from bumps and it will serve you faithfully for years.  I consider this the best value for the money on the market.  I have tried other reasonably priced brands and was disappointed. For the features, speed, memory and hard drive capacity this is the one!  I have been a software engineer for 30 years and work online frequently.  This little number delivered what I needed for professional on the go computing beautifully. Don't know how it works for gaming and other uses but for business applications, internet access. VPN access and professional usage it fills the bill for a very reasonable price. Recommend getting an external USB CD drive to go with it if you will need to read or write CDs and DVDs.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great little laptop (notebook)
Reviews.Author: catlover
Reviews.Content: Has Windows 7 & is great size - my 2 major reasons for buying it. Tried an Asus notebook with Windows 8.0 & touch screen and didn't like at all. Windows 8 is not nearly as easy to use. I have had this notebook for about 6 weeks and the battery life is super - at least 6 hours. Only problem I've had is hooking it up to our HP printer. I think that is our printer and me. No fault of the notebook.Again, great little laptop, easy to use and transport.

Reviews.Title: Weird little beastie
Reviews.Author: critters
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is a seriously strange little computer. First, it has NO CD/DVD drive; and second, it has a completely bizarre plug. Size wise this one reminds me of my mom's Acer Chromebook, but, yes, it DOES run with Windows. At times I find the screen to be too small, and I can't read it, but sometimes the small size (almost pocket sized) is terrific. I didn't realize it didn't have DVD, which has been an adjustment, and the weird, screw on plug is positively huge; it literally takes up my whole power strip. If, however, it manages to be better than last year's lemon (and, hopefully, LOTS better), I'll be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: first and last acer laptop computer
Reviews.Author: collinsj61
Reviews.Content: after a few hours use the acer locked up and wouldn't turn off. i had to return it for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Acer
Reviews.Author: ISMAT A.
Reviews.Content: ACER is...Small and convenient, and of course it's way better than the sucking Windows 8 which makes people sick

Reviews.Title: the worst laptop I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Lola Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop due to the good reviews and I own an Acer tablet that I absolutely love. So I thought: Give  this ACER a try. You could not beat the price, and I didn't have the money to buy a new MAC after mine died.Horrible decision. It stalls on me all the time. I have to reboot so much, it's not even funny anymore. Programs sometimes open or not. Usually I have to reboot if that happens, then it works like a charm, until I try to do another task on this computer.I am so frustrated, that I think to leave this device now just for writing documents, printing and watching movies. By the way: I write this review here on that device, after rebooting this morning again, as usual (often have to remove the battery as well to make it work again). It wasted so much time of my day, that I am more than frustrated. I will look for another laptop now for online duties, and leave this as a spare. After all, it is a good DVD player and burner. But it is not up to the task, and I am not even using it that much. I guess in the end you get what you pay for. After this piece of junk, I am dreaming of the good ole days with my MAC. Will not be able to afford another MAC, so I will check out ASUS for a backup laptop. Because with this piece of junk, you NEED a back up.

Reviews.Title: If I Could Give No Stars, I Would
Reviews.Author: angelina
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my boyfriends birthday which was 2 days ago. I bought it towards the end of February since I wanted to be for sure that it arrived on time. I am so pissed off. We turned it on and it showed Windows starting up, then flashed to  a blue screen, then a black screen and said "Windows cannot repair this computer." I tried reinstalling Windows, no luck. I think the hard drive is corrupt. Last time I buy electronics on Amazon. Also, since I bought it over 30 days ago, guess who spend $400 and isn't getting a refund or new computer? This girl!

Reviews.Title: Power supply defective
Reviews.Author: JanJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my 12 year old for Christmas. The power plug has to be connected to the power adaptor to charge the battery but won't stay connected. The instructions say to push in and turn clockwise until you hear a click. No matter what I do, it won't turn so if you move the cord, it disconnects. I tried calling customer service at Acer but you reach someone in India that is absolutely unintelligible. The phone noise is very bad, they don't speak very good English and don't listen to the problem. He just kept saying "can you turn the laptop on"? This laptop is also very slow and takes quite a while to load anything on the internet. I can only hope it doesn't get any worse.

Reviews.Title: Shipped With Wrong Battery
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Hey Amazon.....Your service is usually so perfect that I'm a little surprised. The battery is not as shown in the product photos. Can I get the correct (flat) battery please.Otherwise, it arrived quickly and without damage.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!!
Reviews.Author: Luciano Insua "Lucho Insua"
Reviews.Content: Cheaply made.  It feels cheap, the keyboard is not very sensitive. The touchpad is clunky and not very responsive, the screen resolution is not very good either.  Good battery life and lightweight.  It is really thick around the battery.

Reviews.Title: Stuck key?
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: The computer is "possessed", the letter "h" just fills in by itself.  I am having a friend look at it , but will probably return it.

Reviews.Title: Just What I needed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this computer for church.  I downloaded a bible software and a dictionary and used Word for my church notes.  It helps me to keep up with my minister.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: S & J
Reviews.Content: Whenever I moved the computer in any way, the screen would flicker off momentarily (screen turned black) then it would turn back on.  Clearly a hardware-related issue.  I returned it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: light, cheap, functional
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to spend a lot of money and use a computer for the basics (browsing, occasional video watching, music downloading, etc., then this is perfect.  I bought it used/refurbished and had no issue setting things up.  I was reluctant at first to buy used, but I'm glad I did and saved a good amount of money.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with performance for the price
Reviews.Author: B. Shields "ShieldsBJS"
Reviews.Content: I inadvertently purchased this laptop without paying attention to the fact that it was an 11.6" screen.  When it arrived, I thought, "oh no, I'm going to have to send this back" but curiosity and the need for a new laptop took over so I took it out of the box and booted it up.  It's not going back.  It is perfect for my needs.  I use it every day for hours at a time.  When I need a large screen, I can connect to a larger monitor but I rarely do that.  It is the perfect size for working off your lap.  Most consumer laptops are enormous and heavy and not ideal for true 'on your lap' computing.  Not this one. Small and relatively lightweight.A couple of times I've heard an unusual sound that from past experience sounds like it could be coming from the hard drive but all health checks continue to come up clean so keeping my fingers crossed and my backups up to date.Running MSOffice 2013 and basic Internet browsing activities and am very happy with the device for the price.  Don't be afraid to get this machine for your student or yourself if you need something small and affordable for basic computing needs.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Judy Kolish
Reviews.Content: was given as a gift

Reviews.Title: exelent for my special needs
Reviews.Author: barranness
Reviews.Content: bought this as a backup for my work. i work for a power company. this netbook fits my needs for the work i use. neough HD space. and i really wanted a windows-7 edition. if i could i would buy another as a spare. soon they wont make them anymore.  also i sue it for my Ham Radio station and for Field Day. yes i would recomend this product. seller shiped fast. thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: it is a good labtop notebook
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: it goies good home had to get resetit is easy to usenice set upit help to use it

Reviews.Title: not as portable as the older 8" version
Reviews.Author: MJ
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't realize my old one was 8", now I wished I'd paid more attention.  The new 11" one isn't as easy to travel with because the battery pack sticks out away from the base, its not a flat surface so it gets caught on things making it harder to pull out of carrying case at airport, for example.  Its also really uncomfortable to rest on your lap when typing.

Reviews.Title: Touch pad is defective
Reviews.Author: lajreader
Reviews.Content: I had an Acer Aspire One 10.1 inch net-book that I loved. Trashed it when I spilled a latte on it while writing at a cafe. So sad. I bought the Acer V5 11.6 thinking going a little bigger might be nice. I also wanted Windows 7 not 8. I like the net-book very much, but like many other users I.HATE.THE.TOUCH.PAD!! It is so defective! I am not liking the larger keyboard either, I spend a lot of time backspacing and deleting if I don't watch what I'm typing. BUMMER!  It's not comfortable to use on my lap, I have to sit at a table if I want to do any serious typing. AGAIN BUMMER! This is a serious issue for me, I've had the V5 for 3 months and I'm ready for a change. I'm thinking I'll mortgage my house and buy an I-Mac.It's too bad, because for the price and it's easy carrying around weight and size this could be a terrific net-book,  It really falls short of the mark with the horrible touch pad and the too wide keyboard. I am regretful to say the least and I miss my little Aspire One immensely.

Reviews.Title: Returned It
Reviews.Author: Liz Hamill "Liz"
Reviews.Content: I originally gave this three stars but after using this computer a few days I couldn't take it anymore - had to return it. Unbearably slooow.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Christina Lorfing
Reviews.Content: It is much smaller than I thought it was going to be compared to the pictures.  The keyboard is not even user friendly where the spacebar is not even in a convenient spot.  I would not recommend this computer to anyone that has to work on a pc.

Reviews.Title: no power to it
Reviews.Author: Ben Ohmart "book publisher"
Reviews.Content: Terrible computer. I had to return it because it wouldn't even start. That is, it was so sluggish, it wouldn't do a damn thing.

Reviews.Title: Problem on Keyboard
Reviews.Author: FRANCISCO N.
Reviews.Content: It came with problem on keyboard, exactly on space bar. It's annoying very much and I won't ever buy any Acer products.

Reviews.Title: working well
Reviews.Author: goodsign
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a back up to my other 2 laptops. Set up was a lovely breeze.I was able to take it out of the box and have it connected to my other W7 machine and install chrome in maybe 30 minutes. But, I'm kind of slow. I like the light weight. My other laptops weigh a ton.Another plus: it doesn't seem to be pre-loaded with a lot of junk. I think McAfee is on there but I haven't figured that out yet. I'll probably switch to Avast. So far a few difficulties with little things, but it works nice.Cheers,

Reviews.Title: junk trackpad - good laptop
Reviews.Author: becky
Reviews.Content: I only rate it as okay because it's forgone major software errors thusfar. However, as advertized, the trackpad is a Piece of $***. It regularly glitches out and refuses to work, and it's obviously a hardware problem since I've already tried reinstalling try drivers. You'd think Acer would do something about this, but as far as I've seen, they're still selling the laptop as is.I bought the model from sams for a hundred dollars more, it came with a terrabyte hard drive and a better service plan ( which of course does nothing about my track pad problem since it only seems to happen when I'm typing a college paper of something of the sort).Overall, as long as you don't mind buying a logitech mouse to go with it, it's a good computer. The webcam works well, it does good browsing the internet. Like any laptop the battery claims are exagerated, but it's still got a good two or three hours of heavy use in it.As far as the touch screen goes it's somewhat unresponsive when it comes to zooming in. However when operating touch-based features such as apps and Windows 8 features it does very well. Which comes in handy when I forget my logitech and my track pad screws up.

Reviews.Title: Eh.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Ok laptop. Has a strange hum to it which is pretty loud for such a small laptop. Good laptop for surfing the internet.

Reviews.Title: Pricing???
Reviews.Author: seakfh "seakfh"
Reviews.Content: this computer dropped to $299.99 yesterday 11/18/13.  I was going to buy today and noticed it went back up to $344.99?  Seems like a good basic computer for those that want win 7.  Would be even better at the lower price.  I guess I will wait and see if it drops again.

Reviews.Title: good not great
Reviews.Author: chris stipak
Reviews.Content: its not put together well. for something new, its a little beet up. other then that its a good laptop.

Reviews.Title: poor display
Reviews.Author: carol a. petry
Reviews.Content: the screen is difficult read  --- is disapOtherwise I like the size, keyboard and battery life but I would not recommendit to someone else ointing!

Reviews.Title: came with hardware issues
Reviews.Author: S. Tan
Reviews.Content: The price is good for the specs and I liked the size but it came with hardware problems so I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire Review
Reviews.Author: Connie Coddington
Reviews.Content: Mouse pad is terrible.  Must have a mouse.  No CD Rom, so can't use any CDs,  Some items are very small due to screen size.Weight and size are convenient and I am getting use to the small keyboard. As an only computer not the ideal choice, but the cost was good.

Reviews.Title: no cd drive
Reviews.Author: mohammed bhuiyan
Reviews.Content: i did not know that it does not have cd drive. now i have to buy portable cd drive. extra $50

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Peach

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: B. Stancliff
Reviews.Content: Main computer use is word processing, web surfing and minor computer based art and photo manipulation. Acer Aspire V5 was purchased after a HP laptop died after three years of rather heavy school use. Main selling points were 4 megs of RAM, 500 meg hard drive and the $340 price at Staples. In the six weeks between the HP dying and my purchasing of the Acer Aspire V5 I sampled a few tablets with the idea that they could adequately replace the HP, I had various issues with each of the tablets but the death knell for all of them was connectivity issues with my printer and their small RAM and hard drives. However, after dealing with this Acer for over a month I feel I would have been better off sticking with the Microsoft Surface. Yes the Acer V5 has 4 megs of RAM, unfortunately the processor takes the speed down to around 1 meg, I had a Gateway 12 years ago that was faster, in all aspects, than this Acer V5. I had to spend a three days scrubbing the bloat ware which was using 90-95% of of the CPU, after uninstalling the mountain of Acer crap it is now running with around 70% of the CPU free, from time to time, however, it starts running slow and shows that 90+% is in use and has to be restarted before it will clear its cache. On top of the memory space issues it also has trouble handling wi-fi signals, connecting isn't an issue, neither is staying connected, where it has issue lies is with the computer accepting that there is in fact internet access. Again, restarting is the only thing that resolves this issue once it starts. On top of those issues I kept getting virus warnings, straight out of the box, from McAfee and Norton both. Downloaded AVG just to make sure and AVG informs me that Windows has been installed incorrectly and is causing a false virus signal. Other issues consist of, touch pad unresponsive to tapping and the scroll is horridly placed (entire right hand edge of touch pad) for a right handed user. The SD card reader is located under the right hand side of the device, an SD card can be inserted without flipping the lap top over, extracting it however is essentially impossible. The SD card reader is slightly recessed and upside down (the nail slot on the card cannot be accessed), if this was a self ejecting slot this would not be an issue, but its not. The first time I used the card reader it took half an hour and a pair of tweezers to remove the card. I will not be using that slot again. All in all I've found the Acer Aspire V5 to be a wonderful, if lightweight and somewhat expensive, paper weight. The chances that I will be purchasing another Acer product in the future are very slim, I didn't expect a super machine, but I did expect something faster and more reliable than a computer I had over a decade ago.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Robbie L. Eidson
Reviews.Content: This computer comes standard with so many viruses and malware that it's unusable. Stay away ... very bad decision to buy this
